question: Which of the following is correct with respect to power of Judicial Review of Supreme Court?
option1: Supreme Court can charge allegations against Prime Minister
option2: Supreme Court has final authority over all issues
option3: Supreme Court can review the issues decided by High Courts
option4: Supreme Court can declare illegal any law of the State
answer: Supreme Court can declare illegal any law of the State
explanation: The doctrine of Judicial Review states that if any laws are found to be violative of the Constitution of India (ultra-vires), the Supreme Court can declare them illegal, unconstitutional and invalid (null and void).
